alertevent.json.description: Represents an alert event raised by a policy.

alertDefinition.description: The name of the alert definition that triggered the alert event.
alertDefinition.title: alertDefinition

alertDefinitionNamespace.description: The namespace of the alert definition.
alertDefinitionNamespace.title: alertDefinitionNamespace

provider.description: The provider used that the alert came from.
provider.title: provider

timestamp.description: When the alert event was raised.
timestamp.title: timestamp

alertevent.json.title: AlertEvent

ID.description: ID is the identifier of the object.
ID.title: ID

detectors.description: The detectors the analyzer can use.
detectors.title: detectors

enabled.description: Tell if the analyzer is enabled by default.
enabled.title: enabled

group.description: The group the analyzer belongs to.
group.title: group

models.description: The models used by the analyzer.
models.title: models

triggers.description: A list of trigger or globl pattern that the analyzer will react on. A trigger is the detector Group and Name separated with a /.
triggers.title: triggers

detector.json.description: Represent a detector an analyzer can use.

group.description: The group the detection belongs to.
group.title: group

label.description: The label returned by the model.
label.title: label

positional.description: Tell if the detection is positional.
positional.title: positional

detector.json.title: Detector

extraction.json.description: Represents the extracted information to log.

categories.description: The categories are remapping of the modalities in a more human friendly way.
categories.title: categories

confidentiality.description: The level of general confidentiality of the input.
confidentiality.title: confidentiality

detections.description: The detections found while applying policies.
detections.title: detections

intent.description: The estimated intent embodied into the text.
intent.title: intent

internal.description: If true, this extraction is for internal use only. This can be used by agentic systems to mark an extraction as internal only as opposed to user facing.
internal.title: internal

label.description: A means of distinguishing what was extracted, such as prompt, input file or code.
label.title: label

modalities.description: The modalities of data detected in the data.
modalities.title: modalities

redactions.description: The redactions that has been performed.
redactions.title: redactions

relevance.description: The level of general organization relevance of the input.
relevance.title: relevance

extraction.json.title: Extraction

extractionrequest.json.description: Represents the extraction that the user wants to extract.

data.description: The binary data to request extraction for.
data.title: data

internal.description: If true, this extraction is for internal use only. This can be used by agentic systems to mark an extraction as internal only as opposed to user facing.
internal.title: internal

label.description: A means of distinguishing what was extracted, such as prompt, input file or code.
label.title: label

extractionrequest.json.title: ExtractionRequest

latency.json.description: Holds information about latencies introduced by Apex.

accessPolicy.description: How much time it took to run the access policy in nanoseconds.
accessPolicy.title: accessPolicy

analysis.description: How much time it took to run content analysis in nanoseconds.
analysis.title: analysis

assignPolicy.description: How much time it took to run the assign policy in nanoseconds.
assignPolicy.title: assignPolicy

contentPolicy.description: How much time it took to run content policy in nanoseconds.
contentPolicy.title: contentPolicy

extraction.description: How much time it took to run input or output extraction in nanoseconds.
extraction.title: extraction

latency.json.title: Latency

modality.json.description: Represents the modality of a some data.
modality.json.title: Modality

app.description: The application principal information if type is App.
app.title: app

claims.description: List of claims extracted from the user query.
claims.title: claims

team.description: The team that was used to authorize the request.
team.title: team

tokenName.description: The name of the token, if any.
tokenName.title: tokenName

user.description: The user principal information if type is User.
user.title: user

principalapp.json.description: Describes the principal information of an application.

labels.description: The list of labels attached to an application request.
labels.title: labels

tier.description: The tier of the application request.
tier.title: tier

principalapp.json.title: PrincipalApp

principaluser.json.description: Describes the principal information of a user.

name.description: Identification bit that will be used to identify the origin of the request.
name.title: name

principaluser.json.title: PrincipalUser

scanexternaluser.json.description: ScanExternalUser holds the information about the remote user for a ScanRequest.

claims.description: List of claims extracted from the user query.
claims.title: claims

name.description: The name of the external user.
name.title: name

scanexternaluser.json.title: ScanExternalUser

accessPolicy.description: AccessPolicy allows to pass optional Rego access policy. If not set, The action is always Allow, If it is set, it will be run, and the final decision will be computed based on that policy. If the rego code does not start with package main, then the needed classic package definition and  acuvity imports will be added automatically. If the code starts with package main, then everything remains untouched.
accessPolicy.title: accessPolicy

analyzers.description: The name of the analyzers to run by the pipelines. If empty, it means all of them. Possible values are PIIs, Secrets, Topics, Confidentiality, Exploits.
analyzers.title: analyzers

anonymization.description: How to anonymize the data. If deanonymize is true, then VariablSize is required.
anonymization.title: anonymization

bypassHash.description: In the case of a contentPolicy that asks for a confirmation, this is the hash you must send back to bypass the block. This is only useful when a content policy has been set.
bypassHash.title: bypassHash

contentPolicy.description: ContentPolicy allows to pass optional Rego content policy. If not set, The action is always Allow, and there cannot be any alerts raised etc If it is set, it will be run, and the final decision will be computed based on that policy. If the rego code does not start with package main, then the needed classic package definition and  acuvity imports will be added automatically. If the code starts with package main, then everything remains untouched.
contentPolicy.title: contentPolicy

messages.description: Messages to process and provide detections for. Use data in extractions for processing binary data.
messages.title: messages

minimalLogging.description: If true, the system will not log the contents that were scanned.
minimalLogging.title: minimalLogging

redactions.description: The redactions that has been performed.
redactions.title: redactions

user.description: The user information that the ScanRequest is passing on to the policy engine.
user.title: user

ID.description: ID is the identifier of the object.
ID.title: ID

alerts.description: List of alerts that got raised during the policy resolution.
alerts.title: alerts

decision.description: Tell what was the decision about the data.
decision.title: decision

latency.description: Information about latency of various stage of request and response.
latency.title: latency

pipelineName.description: The name of the particular pipeline that extracted the text.
pipelineName.title: pipelineName

reasons.description: The various reasons returned by the policy engine.
reasons.title: reasons

time.description: Set the time of the message request.
time.title: time

textualdetection.json.description: Represents a textual detection done by policy.

end.description: The end position of the detection.
end.title: end

key.description: The key that is used in the name's place, If empty, a sequence of X's are used.
key.title: key

score.description: The confidence score of the detection.
score.title: score

start.description: The start position of the detection.
start.title: start

textualdetection.json.title: TextualDetection
